abstract: The deal, valued at $1.82 billion, will help General Electric to part with what it considers noncore businesses.
snippet: The deal, valued at $1.82 billion, will help General Electric to part with what it considers noncore businesses.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said Thursday that it would sell its fire alarm and security systems unit to United Technologies for $1.82 billion, continuing a sale of what the industrial conglomerate considers noncore businesses.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
